title: The Thursday Murder Club
author: Richard Osman
description: In a peaceful retirement village, four unlikely friends meet weekly in the Jigsaw Room to discuss unsolved crimes. Together they call themselves The Thursday Murder Club.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: Alicia Berenson shoots her husband five times in the face, and then never speaks another word. The mystery unfolds as a psychotherapist becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: On Nick and Amy Dunne's fifth wedding anniversary, Amy disappears. Nick's lies and behavior have everyone asking: Did Nick Dunne kill his wife?

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: Rachel takes the same commuter train every morning and night, watching the same couple breakfasting on their deck. Then she sees something shocking.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: Three women, each at a crossroads, whose lives are about to collide in ways they never expected at a school fundraising trivia night.

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Foley
description: A wedding on a remote Irish island turns deadly when someone turns up dead. Everyone is a suspect.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: Lowen Ashleigh is hired to complete the remaining books in a successful series. She discovers an unfinished autobiography that may reveal terrifying truths.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: Aging Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo finally decides to tell her scandalous life story to an unknown magazine reporter, revealing unexpected truths.

title: Beach Read
author: Emily Henry
description: A romance writer who no longer believes in love and a literary writer stuck in a rut engage in a summer-long writing challenge.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
description: Best friends Poppy and Alex take one vacation together every summer for a decade, until something goes wrong. Now they have one more chance to fix things.

title: The Spanish Love Deception
author: Elena Armas
description: Catalina needs a date to her sister's wedding. Her office nemesis Aaron Blackford offers to help, leading to unexpected complications.

title: It Ends with Us
author: Colleen Hoover
description: Lily falls for neurosurgeon Ryle, but when her first love reappears, she must confront difficult truths about relationships and patterns.

title: The Hating Game
author: Sally Thorne
description: Lucy and Joshua hate each other. Not dislike. Hate. But when they're up for the same promotion, their dynamic starts to change.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: Ryland Grace wakes up alone on a spaceship with no memory. He must solve an impossible scientific mystery to save humanity.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library with infinite books, each offering a chance to live another life you could have lived.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: Klara is an Artificial Friend with outstanding observational qualities who watches carefully from her store, hoping to be chosen.

title: The Invisible Life of Addie LaRue
author: V.E. Schwab
description: A woman makes a Faustian bargain to live forever but is cursed to be forgotten by everyone she meets.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
description: A case worker is sent to evaluate a highly classified orphanage for magical children and discovers they might bring about the end of days.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: On the desert planet Arrakis, young Paul Atreides becomes embroiled in a struggle for the spice melange, the universe's most valuable substance.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: The 'Marsh Girl' Kya Clark becomes the prime suspect when the town's golden boy is found dead in the North Carolina marshlands.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: Twin sisters choose to live in two different worlds, one black and one white, in 1960s America.

title: Hamnet
author: Maggie O'Farrell
description: A luminous portrait of a marriage, a family ravaged by grief, and a boy whose name was given to Shakespeare's most famous play.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: After surviving a terrorist attack at an art museum, a boy clings to a painting that becomes his obsession and downfall.

title: A Gentleman in Moscow
author: Amor Towles
description: A Russian count is sentenced to house arrest in a luxury hotel, where he witnesses decades of Russian history from his attic room.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: The complex relationship between Connell and Marianne as they navigate social dynamics from school through university in Ireland.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Death narrates the story of Liesel, a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr
description: A blind French girl and a German boy's paths collide in occupied France as both try to survive the devastation of World War II.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two French sisters struggle to survive and resist the German occupation during World War II in very different ways.

title: The Alice Network
author: Kate Quinn
description: Two women—a female spy from WWI and an American socialite searching for her cousin in 1947—embark on a dangerous mission.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: The daughter of a Titan discovers her power of witchcraft and transforms from an outcast to one of the most powerful figures in mythology.

title: Anxious People
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A failed bank robber takes a group of strangers hostage at an apartment viewing, revealing surprising truths about human nature.

title: The Maid
author: Nita Prose
description: A hotel maid with social difficulties becomes the prime suspect when she discovers a wealthy guest dead in his bed.

title: Lessons in Chemistry
author: Bonnie Garmus
description: In the 1960s, chemist Elizabeth Zott finds herself hosting a TV cooking show, using it to teach women more than recipes.

title: Tomorrow, and Tomorrow, and Tomorrow
author: Gabrielle Zevin
description: Two friends reunite to create video games together, navigating fame, ambition, and the complexities of creative partnership.

title: The Lincoln Highway
author: Amor Towles
description: In 1954, two brothers plan to head west but find their journey derailed by two stowaways from a juvenile work farm.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: Born to survivalists in Idaho, Tara Westover never attended school but went on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The former First Lady shares her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House and beyond.

title: Born a Crime
author: Trevor Noah
description: The Daily Show host's story of growing up in apartheid South Africa, where his birth was literally a crime.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
author: Paul Kalanithi
description: A neurosurgeon facing terminal cancer examines what makes life worth living in this profound memoir.

title: Crying in H Mart
author: Michelle Zauner
description: A memoir about growing up Korean American, losing her mother, and forging her own identity through food and music.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind, exploring how we became the dominant species on Earth.

title: The Warmth of Other Suns
author: Isabel Wilkerson
description: The epic story of America's Great Migration, when six million African Americans fled the South for northern and western cities.

title: Killers of the Flower Moon
author: David Grann
description: The shocking true story of the murders of wealthy Osage people in 1920s Oklahoma and the birth of the FBI.

title: The Devil in the White City
author: Erik Larson
description: The true story of the 1893 World's Fair in Chicago and America's first serial killer.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: Practical strategies for forming good habits, breaking bad ones, and mastering the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

title: The Body Keeps the Score
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: A pioneering researcher transforms our understanding of trauma and offers a bold new paradigm for healing.

title: Untamed
author: Glennon Doyle
description: A memoir and self-help book about breaking free from societal expectations to live an authentic life.

title: Think Again
author: Adam Grant
description: The power of knowing what you don't know and how embracing the joy of being wrong can make you right.

title: Astrophysics for People in a Hurry
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
description: Everything you need to know about the universe in the time it takes to drink your morning coffee.

title: The Code Breaker
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The story of Jennifer Doudna, gene editing, and the future of the human race through CRISPR technology.

title: Braiding Sweetgrass
author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
description: Indigenous wisdom, scientific knowledge, and the teachings of plants come together in this important book.

title: Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat
author: Samin Nosrat
description: Master the four elements of good cooking with this revolutionary approach to food and recipes.

title: Kitchen Confidential
author: Anthony Bourdain
description: The late chef's wild expose of life in professional kitchens and the restaurant industry.

title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: The tragic true story of Chris McCandless, a young man who walked into the Alaska wilderness and never came out.

title: A Walk in the Woods
author: Bill Bryson
description: The humorous account of the author's attempt to hike the Appalachian Trail with his out-of-shape friend.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: A powerful story about a teen who witnesses the fatal shooting of her unarmed friend by a police officer.

title: Percy Jackson & The Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy discovers he's the son of Poseidon and must prevent a war between the Greek gods.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teens with cancer fall in love after meeting at a support group.

title: Six of Crows
author: Leigh Bardugo
description: Six dangerous outcasts must pull off a heist that could make them rich beyond their wildest dreams.

title: They Both Die at the End
author: Adam Silvera
description: Two strangers meet on their last day of life after receiving a death notification.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian future, teens must fight to the death in a televised competition.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
description: Max sails to an island inhabited by Wild Things and becomes their king in this beloved picture book.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
description: A caterpillar eats his way through the week before transforming into a beautiful butterfly.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: The story of a pig named Wilbur and his friend Charlotte, a spider who saves his life.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: A brilliant girl with terrible parents discovers she has telekinetic powers.

title: Maus
author: Art Spiegelman
description: A powerful graphic novel about the Holocaust, depicting Jews as mice and Nazis as cats.

title: Persepolis
author: Marjane Satrapi
description: A memoir of growing up in Iran during the Islamic Revolution, told through black-and-white comics.

title: The Sun and Her Flowers
author: Rupi Kaur
description: A collection of poetry about growth, healing, ancestry, and honoring one's roots.

title: The Hill We Climb
author: Amanda Gorman
description: The poem that captivated the world, delivered at President Biden's inauguration.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A shepherd boy's journey to the Egyptian pyramids teaches him to follow his dreams and listen to his heart.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl in Depression-era Alabama witnesses her father defend a Black man falsely accused of a crime.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan in Jazz Age America.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo Baggins must destroy the One Ring to save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: An orphaned boy discovers he's a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: Noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne in the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros.

title: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: In a world of stone and storms, ancient powers awaken as civilization faces collapse.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield's story of teenage rebellion and alienation in 1950s New York City.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of marriage, morality, and misunderstandings in Georgian England.

author: George Orwell
description: Winston Smith struggles against totalitarian government surveillance in a bleak future.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society achieves happiness through genetic engineering, psychological manipulation, and drugs.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a theocratic future America, women are subjugated and forced into reproductive servitude.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: Letters from a Black woman in the rural South chronicle her journey from abuse to self-discovery.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A former slave is haunted by the ghost of her baby daughter in post-Civil War Ohio.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: Ten strangers invited to an island are murdered one by one in this classic whodunit.

title: The Stand
author: Stephen King
description: After a plague wipes out most of humanity, survivors must choose between good and evil.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family's winter caretaking job at an isolated hotel turns into a nightmare of madness and terror.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: A teenager searches for an Easter egg hidden in a massive virtual reality world.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A brilliant child is trained at a military academy in space to defend Earth from alien invasion.
